title: Marine Biology Words
description: Dive into the vocabulary of marine biology, from coral reefs and deep-sea creatures to ocean currents and aquatic ecosystems.

questions.question: What is 'plankton'?
options: Sand found on the ocean floor
Large fish that swim in deep water
Tiny organisms that drift in water and form the base of aquatic food chains

questions.question: What does 'bioluminescence' mean?
options: The production and emission of light by a living organism
The ability to swim at great depths
The reflection of sunlight on water

questions.question: What is the 'pelagic zone'?
options: The area where rivers meet the sea
The open water column of the ocean, away from the bottom and shore

questions.question: What is an 'estuary'?
options: A partially enclosed body of water where freshwater and saltwater mix

questions.question: What does 'benthic' refer to?
options: Relating to the bottom of a body of water

questions.question: What is a 'coral polyp'?
options: A tiny marine animal that secretes calcium carbonate to form coral reefs

questions.question: What does 'salinity' measure in marine science?
options: The concentration of dissolved salts in water

questions.question: What is 'algae bloom'?
options: A rapid increase in the population of algae in a water system
The growth of barnacles on ships

questions.question: What is the 'photic zone'?
options: The upper layer of water where sunlight penetrates enough for photosynthesis
The deepest part of the ocean

questions.question: What does 'anadromous' mean?
options: Describing fish that migrate from the sea to freshwater to spawn, like salmon

questions.question: What is a 'cetacean'?
options: A marine mammal such as a whale, dolphin, or porpoise

questions.question: What is 'ocean acidification'?
options: The pollution of oceans with plastic
The decrease in ocean pH caused by absorption of excess carbon dioxide
The increase of salt in the ocean

questions.question: What is a 'thermocline'?
options: The surface temperature of the ocean
A volcanic vent on the ocean floor
A layer of water where temperature changes rapidly with depth

questions.question: What does 'symbiotic' mean in the context of marine life?
options: Two different organisms living in close association, often to mutual benefit

questions.question: What is the 'abyssal plain'?
options: A sandy beach formed by erosion
The flat, deep ocean floor typically found at depths of 3,000 to 6,000 meters
